question: Who has become the first woman editor of the Financial Times?
explanation: Roula Khalaf will become the first woman to edit the Financial Times in its 131-year history after Lionel Barber, Britainâ€™s most senior financial journalist steps down. Ms. Khalaf has served as deputy editor, foreign editor and Middle East editor during her more than two decades at the salmon-pink Financial Times and in recent years has sought to increase diversity in the newsroom and attract more female readers.
